description: This is the second course in the two course sequence involving the capstone design project. See MEAM 445 for course description.
name: MECH ENG DESIGN PROJECTS

values.comments:
MEAM 446 is the second semester of the capstone design project sequence for MEAM majors. As an extension of MEAM 445, this course requires students to work individually or in groups to select projects in which they will learn design, development, and experimentation strategies under the supervision of a MEAM faculty advisor. The course also focuses on project planning, patent and library searches, and technical presentation.

Students were required to attend some lectures on statistics, but otherwise the course was mostly self-directed. Many complained that these lectures were unnecessary and irrelevant. Some noted that it was “poorly structured” as well.

Professor Jeffcoat simply supervised the course. Students interacted with their advisors for the most part.

This course requires Junior standing to take, so is not open to underclassmen. The workload is mostly self-determined, but usually ends up taking a moderate amount of time.
